OrgName.entry: SHEFFIELD HEALTH AND SOCIAL CARE NHS FOUNDATION TRUST - ADULT MENTAL HEALTH SERVICE

Desc.entry: Adult Mental Health Services (for people under 65 years) are divided into two directorates in Sheffield Health & Social Care NHS Foundation Trust. The Acute Community and Primary Care Directorate includes: four Sector Community Mental Health teams (CMHTs); the Crisis Resolution and Home Treatment Team; the Acute Inpatient Wards; Psycotherapy services; Transcultural Services; and the Intensive Treatment Service. The Recovery Rehabilitation and Specialist Service Directorate includes: four Continuing Needs Service CMHTs; Forest Close and Pinecroft (previously known as Fairlawns) Inpatient Rehabilitation wards; Forest Lodge Low Secure Inpatient ward; Sheffield Outreach Team; the Homeless Assessment and Support Team; North and South Day Services; Community Support Services (NESS and Howard Road); Wainwright Crescent Respite Service; the Eating Disorder Service; the Perinatal Service; the Porterbrook Clinic for Gender and Relationship Difficulties; and the Liaison Service.

DisabledAccess.entry: Some parts of the building have wheelchair access and disabled toilet, please contact for details
